required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: BIIB033 Single Ascending Dose Study in Healthy Volunteer Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Blinded, Placebo-Controlled, Single Ascending Dose Study of the Safety, Tolerability, and Pharmacokinetics of BIIB033 in Healthy Adult Volunteers

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective of the study is to evaluate the safety and tolerability of single dose of BIIB033 administered to healthy adult volunteers.

detailed_description.textblock: BIIB033 is an investigational product being developed to promote remyelination in subjects with multiple sclerosis (MS). This healthy volunteer study will evaluate safety and tolerability of a single dose of BIIB033.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Safety as measured by adverse event monitoring, laboratory assessments and MRI
Tolerability as measured by adverse event monitoring, laboratory assessments and MRI

secondary_outcome.measure: Exploratory blood, urine and CSF biomarkers

arm_group.description: Single dose of saline solution (8 cohorts IV; 1 cohort SC)
Single, escalating doses of BIIB033 (8 cohorts IV; 1 cohort SC)

intervention.description: Single, escalating doses of BIIB033 (8 cohorts IV, 1 cohort SC)
Single dose of placebo comparator (8 cohorts IV, 1 cohort SC)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Must be in good health
- BMI of 18-30kg/m2
- Contraception required for at least 6 months after study drug administration
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of clinically significant disease or lab values
- Females of childbearing potentials
- Contraindication to brain MRI and/or lumbar puncture
- Treatment with any prescription medication within the 28 days prior to study entry
- Treatment with any over-the-counter products, including herbal and/or alternative health preparations and procedures within the 14 days prior to study entry
- Regular use of any tobacco product within 3 months prior to study entry

reference.citation: Tran JQ, Rana J, Barkhof F, Melamed I, Gevorkyan H, Wattjes MP, de Jong R, Brosofsky K, Ray S, Xu L, Zhao J, Parr E, Cadavid D. Randomized phase I trials of the safety/tolerability of anti-LINGO-1 monoclonal antibody BIIB033. Neurol Neuroimmunol Neuroinflamm. 2014 Aug 21;1(2):e18. doi: 10.1212/NXI.0000000000000018. eCollection 2014 Aug.
